ARABIC: أَمْ حَسِبْتَ أَنَّ أَصْحَٰبَ ٱلْكَهْفِ وَٱلرَّقِيمِ كَانُوا۟ مِنْ ءَايَٰتِنَا عَجَبًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Do you consider that the Companions of the Cave and Ar-Raqim were one of the most remarkable of Our Signs?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Do you think the men of the cave and Ar-Raqim were so strange among Our signs?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Do you think that the people of the Cave and the Inscription were one of Our wondrous signs?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Do you not think that the story of the Companions of the Cave and the Inscription was one of Our marvelous miracles?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Did you know that the People of the Cave and People close to the Woods, were Our exceptional signs?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Do you think that the people of Al-Kahf and Ar-Raqim were a wonder among Our signs
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Or, do you think that the Fellows of the Cave and the Inscription were of Our wonderful signs?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Or dost thou think the Men of the Cave and Er-Rakeem were among Our signs a wonder?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Or deemest thou that the People of the Cave and the Inscription are a wonder among Our portents?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Do you think that the Men of the Cave and the Inscription were one of Our wondrous signs?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Deemest thou that the people of the cave and the inscription were of Our signs a wonder?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Do you suppose that the Companions of the Cave and the Inscription were among Our wonderful signs?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Or dost thou reflect that the Companions of the Cave and of the Inscription were wonders among Our Sign?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Do you think that the people of the Cave and the Inscription (the news or the names of the people of the Cave) were a wonder among Our Signs?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Or, do you think the companions of the Cave and the tomb stone were a wonder among Our signs?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Did you know that the People of the Cave and the Inscription were of Our wondrous signs?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Or have you thought that the companions of the cave and the inscription were, among Our signs, a wonder?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [18:9] Or did you think, did you suppose, that the Companions of the Cave, the cavern in the mountain, and the Inscription, the tablet wherein their names and lineages had been inscribed — the Prophet (s) had been asked about their tale — were, with regard to their tale, a [unique] marvel from among, the entirety [of], Our signs? (‘ajaban, ‘a marvel’ is the predicate of [the defective verb] kāna [sc. kānū], the preceding [min āyātinā, ‘from among Our signs’] being a circumstantial qualifier). In other words, [did you suppose] that they were a marvel exclusively from among all [Our] other signs, or that they were the most marvellous among them? Not so.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Or deemest thou) Muhammad (that the People of the Cave and the Inscription) whereof the names of these youth and their story were inscribed; it is also said that the inscription refers to the valley where this cave was; and it is also said that it refers to a city (are a wonder among Our portents) such as the sun, the moon, the sky, the earth, the stars, the oceans and even that which is more wonderous than this?
